intro: Adenostemum, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apocynaceae. These plants are native to various regions in Africa, Madagascar, and the Arabian Peninsula. They are characterized by their milky sap, which can be toxic and is used in traditional medicine. Adenostemum species typically have simple, alternate leaves and produce showy, often yellow or orange flowers. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value.
